intro: Psoralea remotiflora, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy habitats and is often found in grassland environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind, contributing to its distribution across arid regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some areas.
